title: Sonora
description: Interactive audiobooks with AI narration and branching stories.
subtitle: AI-Powered Interactive Audiobook Platform
overview: Interactive audiobook platform with AI narration and choice-driven stories. Pick a voice, explore multiple paths, and generate audio in real time.

bullets: AI voices via ElevenLabs and OpenAI
Real‑time audio with word‑level timing and subtitles
Responsive player with timeline, replay, and choices

features: Library: 10+ interactive stories (e.g., The Enchanted Forest, The Midnight Library, Project Hail Mary)
Voices: create and preview custom voices; high‑quality TTS
Performance: pre‑recorded fallback and smart source detection

projectStructure: Audio pipeline for TTS and subtitles
Static generation with lazy loading and code splitting
deployment: Secure env config and optimized builds

personalExperience: Sonora was one of my most technically challenging projects. Working with real-time audio generation, word-level timing, and branching narratives required me to dive deep into audio processing and state management. Integrating with ElevenLabs and OpenAI APIs taught me a lot about working with external services and handling async operations efficiently. The branching story system was particularly interesting to architect, as it required careful consideration of state management and user flow. Building the audio player with timeline controls and subtitle synchronization was a great learning experience in media handling. This project at Binedge allowed me to work on cutting-edge technology and push the boundaries of what I thought was possible with web technologies. The satisfaction of seeing users navigate through interactive stories with AI-generated voices was incredible.
